comments:
For I20060208-0848, the Ant UI tests failed on the Mac with:

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem._getExpanded(TreeItem.java:195)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree.setScrollWidth(Tree.java:2810)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem.setText(TreeItem.java:1312)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem.setText(TreeItem.java:1278)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.viewers.AsynchronousTreeModelViewer.setLabels(AsynchronousTreeModelViewer.java:820)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.viewers.ModelLabelRequestMonitor.performUpdate(ModelLabelRequestMonitor.java:72)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.viewers.AsynchronousModelRequestMonitor$1.runInUIThread(AsynchronousModelRequestMonitor.java:60)
at org.eclipse.ui.progress.UIJob$1.run(UIJob.java:93)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123)
Looks like an SWT bug. We're just calling setText on a TreeItem. Running the ant test suite produces lots of these errors.
In Tree.setScrollWidth(..) it looks like the TreeItem is not disposed, but it's parentItem is disposed.
What are the steps to recreate the error?

I am unable to recreate your error just using the debug perspective or in a standalone SWT example.

I have never run org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui before.  What do I have to get out of CVS etc.  I only have the eclipse SDK installed and I only have SWT in my workspace - what else do I need?  I tried to check out org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui for CVS and it ran some script that failed and it doesn't compile.

I have org.eclipse.ant.core, org.eclipse.ant.ui, org.eclispe.ant.tests.ui, org.eclipse.ant.test.core and org.apache.ant in my workspace. 
Run AntUITests.java to run the UI test suite.

I've seen this bug a lot while using the debugger, but I haven't nailed down a test case yet. It seems to have some thing to do with clearing terminated launches from the Debug View. I'll try to find a better test case for you.

All you should need is (the rest picked up as plugin dependencies):
  org.eclipse.ant.ui
  org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui
(do a clean of org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui so that the support JARs are generated properly)

Run org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui.testplugin.AntUITests as a JUnit plugin test
With this test suite I could get the problem every time.
This may be fixed on I20060210-0800 already. The ant test suite isn't doing it for me anymore.
Ran the AntUITests on Panther and Tiger with I20060210-0800 and ant tests from HEAD.  Worked for me.
Silenio changed a bunch of code to support owner draw in tree - this may have been fixed as a side affect.
I will close for now.  Please reopen if it happens again.
